channel.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
channel.description:
I get this error when I hit the bank all tab. Only hit it once too :o http://prntscr.com/6txrax It says bank full! 24 times and lags the server.
Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Elegant Elegant
item.description:
@Elegant wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:551095”][quote author=Elegant link=topic=670010.msg4480299#msg4480299 date=1429152673]

You pasted the code wrong… Make sure you only replace the for loop.

I did, here is what it looks like now - http://prntscr.com/6uanhe

Current error - http://prntscr.com/6uanmv

[/quote]
No, you didn’t. Because the variable I used in the for loop is “itemSlot”. The variable you have in yours is “itemID”.
Either change itemID to itemSlot, or itemSlot to itemID.[/quote]
My bad, skipped the top line on purpose - http://prntscr.com/6uaqn9 - Compiled with no errors

Tried on the server and it’s working perfectly! Thank you so much

Cheers

Read full topic

Either change itemID to itemSlot, or itemSlot to itemID.

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Elegant Elegant
item.description:
@Elegant wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:551095”]That is a really strange way to deposit items…

I’d think something like this would be more efficient…

for(int itemSlot = 0; itemSlot < 28; itemSlot++) { if(!c.getItems().bankSlotsUsed() >= Config.BANK_SIZE) { break;// The bank is full.. } if(c.playerItems[itemSlot] > -1 && c.playerItemsN[itemSlot] > 0)// if the slot has an item. c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[itemSlot], itemSlot, c.playerItemsN[itemSlot]);// Deposits all items in the slot. }

Note: if you try and deposit 2 billion coins while you have 2 billion in the bank, it will still print “bank full”[/quote]

Thank you, I did get this error though http://prntscr.com/6uagtv

Read full topic
item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That is a really strange way to deposit items…

I’d think something like this would be more efficient…

for(int itemSlot = 0; itemSlot < 28; itemSlot++) { if(!c.getItems().bankSlotsUsed() >= Config.BANK_SIZE) { break;// The bank is full.. } if(c.playerItems[itemSlot] > -1 && c.playerItemsN[itemSlot] > 0)// if the slot has an item. c.getItems().bankItem(c.playerItems[itemSlot], itemSlot, c.playerItemsN[itemSlot]);// Deposits all items in the slot. }

Note: if you try and deposit 2 billion coins while you have 2 billion in the bank, it will still print “bank full”

Read full topic
item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Elegant Elegant
item.description:
@Elegant wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:6, topic:551095”][quote author=penguinimp link=topic=670010.msg4480268#msg4480268 date=1429135013]

public boolean bankHasSpace() { for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItems[i] == -1) { return true; } } return false; }[/quote]

public boolean bankHasSpace() { return bankItems[playerBankSize-1] == -1; }
[/quote]

Thanks guys, if you don’t mind could you look at my code? How would I integrate that code into mine? http://prntscr.com/6ua71k

switch (actionButtonId){ case 89223: //Deposit Inventory for(int itemID = 0; itemID < 101; itemID++) { for(int invSlot = 0; invSlot < 28; invSlot++) { c.getItems().bankItem(itemID, invSlot, 2147000000); } } break;

Read full topic
item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @penguinimp penguinimp
item.description:
@penguinimp wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:6, topic:551095”][quote author=penguinimp link=topic=670010.msg4480268#msg4480268 date=1429135013]

public boolean bankHasSpace() { for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItems[i] == -1) { return true; } } return false; }[/quote]

public boolean bankHasSpace() { return bankItems[playerBankSize-1] == -1; }[/quote]

Appreciated, going to the end of the array and seeing if you have space will usually work, it won’t always work if your bank is full and you with draw and item in the middle of the bank (unless you rebuild the array)

Which might be the case in all sources, I’m completely recoding every method I find in the delta source I found because I’ve realized everything is terrible.

@on topic

if you do decide to use this method

	public boolean bankHasSpace() {
		return bankItems[playerBankSize-1] == -1;
	}

You don’t need to call if (bankHasSpace()) { you can simply use if (bankItems[playerBankSize-1] == -1) {

Read full topic

[quote=“penguinimp, post:5, topic:551095”] public boolean bankHasSpace() { for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItems[i] == -1) { return true; } } return false; }[/quote]

public boolean bankHasSpace() { return bankItems[playerBankSize-1] == -1; }

Read full topic
item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @penguinimp penguinimp
item.description:
@penguinimp wrote:

One server I first delta server I developed when I picked it up always gave null all the time of clicking it. It’s array was wrong, it checked your inventory from 1-29 instead of 0-28, might also be worth while to check.

depending on your methods you could do something like this

    public boolean bankHasSpace(int itemToCheck) {
        for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {
            if (bankItems[i] == -1 || bankItems[i] == itemToCheck) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
    public void bankAll() {
        for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
            if (playerItems[i] != -1) {
                if (bankHasSpace()) {
                    bankItem(playerItems[i], i, playerItemsN[i]);
                } else {
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
    }

Or you can modify your bankItem method and make sure it declines to put it in the bank if you don’t have room. Not sure how yours is written.

The more correct method might be to create a new bankItem that will handle an array of arrays one array for each item (itemid, and slot) of the items from your inventory and then you don’t need to do a bankHasSpace() for every item, more correct, harder to do, up to you.

Read full topic

item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Elegant Elegant
item.description:
@Elegant wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551095”]Pretty simple on as to what causes the error, actually.

The way most people design the “bank all” button is they use a for loop to loop the entire inventory, and deposits each item/stack accordingly.

What you need to do to fix it:
Find the loop, and add in an if statement to check if the bank is full before inserting the item. If full, then stop the for loop (Use a “break;”).
You may also want to add in a check to see if the item stack is “full”. Because that also will say “Bank full” when attempting to deposit an item.[/quote]

Okay thank you, what file would contain the code to this loop?

Read full topic
item.source: Bank all tab error - Please help!

item.title: Bank all tab error - Please help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Pretty simple on as to what causes the error, actually.

The way most people design the “bank all” button is they use a for loop to loop the entire inventory, and deposits each item/stack accordingly.

What you need to do to fix it:
Find the loop, and add in an if statement to check if the bank is full before inserting the item. If full, then stop the for loop (Use a “break;”).
You may also want to add in a check to see if the item stack is “full”. Because that also will say “Bank full” when attempting to deposit an item.

Read full topic
